meanings.definition: A line, mark, or band differing in color or texture from the surface around it.
meanings.sent1: I saw a streak of red paint on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The rainbow had a beautiful streak of colors.
meanings.sent3: The streak of sunlight through the window made the room look cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting was a streak of brilliance in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The streak of lightning across the sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A brief run or stretch of good or bad luck.
meanings.sent1: His winning streak in the game was impressive.
meanings.sent2: She hoped her lucky streak would continue at the casino.
meanings.sent3: The streak of bad luck seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: The streak of good fortune finally turned in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The winning streak brought a smile to his face.

meanings.definition: To move quickly in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The car will streak past us on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The shooting star will streak across the night sky.
meanings.sent3: He will streak through the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent4: The comet will streak through space at incredible speed.
meanings.sent5: The athlete will streak ahead of the competition in the sprint.
